content: hey, maybe let's define this for next meeting
what we are currently doing is searching for to-announce, add to the agenda and remove to-announce label
just that, but maybe we need to track status and do something different

personally I think we should list out

  • MCP proposals that have been seconded and hence are in FCP (definitely check those out...)
  • New MCP proposals
  • Older MCP proposals
I'm not sure if older MCP proposals should be all of them, or just "really old" ones or something...
but for sure when things are in FCP that should be announced at the meeting I think,
will tweak our procedure to consider that
side note that I forgot what I had in mind once an MCP is accepted
I feel like I was expecting to .. just close the issue?
maybe I should just add a label or something and close it
@nikomatsakis does this sounds good for the meeting tomorrow ...

• Major Changes Proposals:
    • Seconded proposals (in FCP)
      • "Implement LLVM-compatible source-based code coverage" #278
      • "Inline assembly" #280
      • "intern predicates, introduce forall/implies" #285
      • "Reintegrate chalk into rustc" #289 (NEW)
      • "Virtual locals scheme" #291 (NEW)
    • New proposals (not seconded)
      • "RFC 2229 implementation plan" #292
    • Old proposals (not seconded)
      • "Integration of the Cranelift backend with rustc" #270
      • "Decentralize queries" #277
      • "illumos toolchain builds" #279
except that I think the virtual locals scheme #291 has a kind of objection
I should note that in the issue (done)
